question: You are currently trying to improve your knowledge of a language which is not your first language. You have a friend who speaks this language fluently. You have decided to write to this friend.Write a letter to your friend. In your letter,•	explain why you want to improve your knowledge of this language – •	ask him/her for suggestions on how to learn more quickly •	propose that you meet your friend to talk about it
text: I hope you and your family are in good spirits. I am really sorry I couldn't make it to your parents' anniversary last week owing to a few unrealistic deadlines at work.

I am writing this letter to seek a few suggestions from you in order to learn french better since it is your first language. The reason for this is that I shall be travelling to France this year as an exchange student for a period of 6 months, having scored exceptionally well in my second (2) semester.

Perhaps, I was wondering if you may recommend to me any book, audio book, or online course, which may help me to brush up my french in a short span of time, considering that I am scheduled to kickstart my third (semester) in the following month. So, I hardly have any time on my hands.
What's more, I think we should meet in person and discuss these things over a coffee at your favourite restaurt, The Big Chill Cafe, on Thursday at 7:00 Pm. Do let me know of your plans.
I look forward to hearing from you soon.
